title: 'How gullible do you think we are?' Manager rebukes defense
description: Lead impeachment manager Rep. Jamie Raskin (D-MD) says convicting former President Trump will set a precedent and forbid any future presidential incitement to violent insurrection under the impeachment clauses.

title: Biden administration says it intends to close Guantanamo prison
description: The Biden administration intends to close the Guantánamo Bay detention facility, which houses approximately 40 prisoners, by the end of their term.

title: Capitol rioters scrambling to scrub phones and pictures
description: While scores of Capitol rioters flaunted their role in the January 6 attack, a growing number of insurrectionists are accused of covering their tracks by destroying cellphones, wiping social media posts and threatening witnesses.

title: 6 skeletons found at a pirate shipwreck site
description: For the pirates of the 18th century, treasure meant gold.

title: See giant snow artwork from above
description: The artwork, which stretches across 160 meters (525 feet), was carved in the snow on a golf course in Finland.

title: 'Chappelle's Show' is back on Netflix and Dave Chappelle is thrilled
description: "Chappelle's Show" is available to stream again after Dave Chappelle reached a licensing agreement with the show's owner, ViacomCBS. In November 2020, it was pulled at his request.

title: Capitol rioters boasted on social media. Now, they're scrambling to scrub phones and pictures
White House suspends official for threatening to 'destroy' reporter over story about him
description: White House press secretary Jen Psaki said Friday that one of her deputies, TJ Ducklo, had been suspended for one week without pay after a Vanity Fair story revealed Ducklo had threatened a reporter who was working on a story about his romantic relationship with another reporter.

title: Anchor reacts to montage Trump's lawyer played at trial
description: CNN's Jake Tapper, Dana Bash and Abby Phillip discusses Trump's attorney Michael van der Veen presenting a montage of Democrats and celebrities at President Trump's second impeachment trial.

title: Hear Press Secretary Psaki's comments on suspended deputy
description: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki announced that one of her deputies, TJ Ducklo, had been suspended for one week without pay after a Vanity Fair story revealed Ducklo had threatened a reporter who was working on a story about his romantic relationship with another reporter.

title: Nike sneakers designed in honor of Obama withdrawn from sale, auction house says
description: An exclusive pair of Nike basketball sneakers designed in honor of former President Barack Obama were pulled from the luxury auctioneer Sotheby's ahead of their anticipated sale Friday.

title: Justin Timberlake apologizes to Britney Spears and Janet Jackson
description: Justin Timberlake is trying to make good.

title: What life is like inside a protest camp set up by thousands of farmers
description: Since November, tens of thousands of farmers in India have been protesting against three agricultural laws introduced by the government. Since then, they have set up multiple camps on the outskirts of the capital, New Delhi, and refuse to leave until the laws are permanently repealed. CNN's Vedika Sud gains access inside one of these camps and looks at daily life for the thousands of protesters.

title: UK economy suffered its biggest slump on record in 2020
description: The UK economy suffered its biggest slump on record in 2020, with GDP falling by 9.9% over the course of the year.

title: Video shows massive winter car pile up
description: At least six people were killed and several were injured in a massive pile up caused by icy weather conditions on Interstate 35W in Fort Worth, Texas.

title: 'There's never been a time like this': Wall Street is piling into trading cards as prices soar
description: Ken Goldin has sold sports trading cards for four decades. What happened earlier this month still shocked him.

title: The UK economy shrank by nearly 10%  in 2020
description: The Covid-19 pandemic has effectively wiped out all growth in the United Kingdom over the last 7 years, returning the economy close to the size it was in 2013.

title: US files complaint with Israel over unfair airline treatment for Tel Aviv flights
description: The US Department of Transportation has filed a complaint with Israel over unfair treatment of airlines, stemming from the closure of Ben Gurion International Airport in which Israel has allowed the country's El Al airline to fly passengers but barred US airlines from doing the same, an Israeli official with knowledge of the complaint confirmed to CNN.

title: How chocolate fell in love with Valentine's Day
Watch new footage taken from Mars' orbit
description: Beijing shared footage of China's Tianwen-1 probe orbiting Mars after the spacecraft successfully entered the red planet's orbit seven months following its launch.

title: University retires mascot that shares name with Ku Klux Klan newspaper
description: Students who attend Valparaiso University are Crusaders no more.

title: KPMG's UK boss resigns after telling staff not to 'sit there and moan' about the pandemic
description: The UK chairman of accounting firm KPMG is resigning after he told staff in a meeting to stop complaining about the pandemic and said that there was "no such thing as unconscious bias."

title: Nigerian government urges #EndSARS movement to shelve the planned protests at Lekki Toll Gate
description: The Nigerian government has urged sympathizers of the #EndSARS movement to shelve plans for renewed protests at the Lekki Toll Gate in Lagos.

title: After losing five loved ones to Covid-19, one woman is among many fighting to dispel the myths
How chocolate fell in love with Valentine's Day
description: The connection between chocolate and Valentine's Day is a fairly recent one by historical standards. Cupids, angels and roses were all part of the romantic vernacular by the 1800s, but it took one mere mortal to unite chocolate and Valentine's Day.

title: Trump team tipped their hand on omitting facts
Nikki Haley criticizes Trump and says he has no future in the GOP
Novak Djokovic defeats Taylor Fritz in five-set epic as fans are told to leave due to Melbourne quarantine
description: Novak Djokovic battled through injury to survive a comeback by Taylor Fritz in the third round of the Australian Open, triumphing 7-6 6-4 3-6 4-6 6-2.

title: The former President's lawyers have one goal: Do no harm
description: Former President Donald Trump's legal team gets its turn at the Senate impeachment trial Friday, as Trump's lawyers prepare to argue that the trial of a former president is unconstitutional and Trump's speech on January 6 did not incite the rioters who attacked the US Capitol.

title: This fish looks like a hedge-trimmer -- but its days could be numbered
description: The sawfish is one of the ocean's stranger sights -- with its unique long, narrow nose lined with teeth, it resembles a hedge-trimmer or chain saw.

title: 'They're unrecognizable': One woman reflects on losing her parents to QAnon
description: As Joe Biden was taking the oath of office to become President of the United States, 20-year-old Lily was holding her breath. "I thought, for sure this would be it," she said. Finally, the moment she'd been waiting for months  to arrive was here.

title: Rep. Clyburn calls senators' meeting with Trump defense team 'inappropriate'
description: Rep. James Clyburn (D-SC) calls out the three GOP senators who met with former President Donald Trump's impeachment defense team as being inappropriate.

title: Biden says he's anxious to see what Republicans do
description: President Joe Biden told CNN Friday he is "anxious" to see how Senate Republicans will vote in the impeachment trial and whether they will "stand up."

title: Facebook has become a $770 billion clone factory
description: There was an exciting moment four years ago when it seemed like Facebook was doing something truly jaw-dropping. The company set up a new hardware division called Building 8, staffed it with scientists and engineers overseen by an executive from DARPA, and announced it was building technology to help you type with your brain and "hear" with your skin.

title: Melania Trump disengaged from her husband's second impeachment trial
description: While former President Donald Trump watches his second impeachment trial unfold, Melania Trump spends most of her time post-White House relaxing at the spa and staying out of the fray.

title: The potential outcome for Trump could be hard for some Republican senators to explain to constituents
description: Donald Trump's defense lawyers face a daunting mission Friday in refuting a devastating impeachment case that the former President is a dangerous tyrant who turned his mob on his fellow Americans.

title: Fernando Alonso, two-time Formula One champion, injured while cycling in Switzerland
description: Two-time Formula One World Champion Fernando Alonso was hospitalized after a road accident while cycling in Switzerland, according to a tweet from the Alpine F1 Team.

title: Germany tightens borders with neighbors to curb spread of new Covid variants
description:
• Australian Open to go without fans as 'new kind of enemy' forces Victoria to lock down 
• LIVE UPDATES: The US has conducted more tests than it has residents

title: CNN's Enten: Majority of GOP senators not up for reelection in 2 years
description: CNN's Harry Enten joins Chris Cuomo to look at the Republican senators that will be running for reelection in the 2022 primaries.

title: Easy, breezy ... bald? James Charles says he's shaved his head but the Internet isn't sure
description: If there's one thing beauty vlogger James Charles knows really well, it's how to cause a stir.

title: See how Hong Kong will celebrate Lunar New Year amid pandemic
description: The Lunar New Year is usually a time of raucous joy in Hong Kong -- large social gatherings, night parades and massive firework displays. But all these traditions have been put on hold as Hong Kong continues to battle Covid-19. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout looks at how the people of Hong Kong are welcoming the Year of the Ox during a time of deep uncertainty.

title: The luxury manmade island concept where homes cost up to $1 billion
description: Packing up and moving to an exotic island has been a long-held dream for many globetrotters, but it seems the prospect is becoming even more attractive due to the global pandemic.

title: Biden administration will begin processing migrants forced to stay in Mexico this month
Climate change is making pollen season — and your allergies — worse
description: Climate change has made pollen seasons in the United States and Canada worse, exacerbating allergies, a new study has revealed.

title: Meet the orbiters that help rovers on Mars talk to Earth
description: While robotic rovers may explore the surface of Mars on behalf of humans who can't safely land there yet, they aren't alone.

title: Jacksonville Jaguars head coach defends controversial hire
description: New Jacksonville Jaguars head coach Urban Meyer has defended the hiring of a former controversial coach who has previously been accused of racism and bullying.

title: A corner of Europe still welcoming outsiders
description: While most European Union nations have kept their borders sealed against non-European visitors during the pandemic, Croatia has been welcoming arrivals from the United States and many other countries.

title: Claressa Shields takes jab at boxing over coverage, treatment of female fighters
description: If you haven't seen enough of boxer Claressa Shields -- or if you may not even know the name -- that's her point. She's an elite athlete in her prime, suffering from an apparent case of under-exposure.

title: She rose to top her game as a model before being diagnosed with cancer
description: In July 2019, Slick Woods had no idea that a routine dental appointment would leave her with a life-altering diagnosis. During an appointment, her dentist noticed suspicious spots, and took samples for further analysis. Soon after, she received the call informing her that she had stage 3 melanoma.

title: Myanmar military releases more than 23,000 prisoners as protests against coup continue
5 takeaways from the third day of Trump's impeachment trial
To help preserve his island paradise, this musician in Mauritius is turning trash into instruments
description: Kan Chan Kin is a musician, artist and activist. Or, as his social media handle implies, you can simply refer to him as an "artivist" whose eco-friendly work is motivated and inspired by trash -- more specifically, how society can create less of it.

title: Tokyo 2020 Olympics president announces resignation following sexist remarks
description: Tokyo 2020 Olympics chief Yoshiro Mori said he will resign due to the fallout after sexist remarks he made at a meeting were leaked to the public.

title: Bernstein: Donald Trump is 'first seditious president in our history'
description: CNN political analyst and renowned Watergate reporter, Carl Bernstein, calls former President Donald Trump "the most evil force in the White House that we have ever seen."

title: This may be the most fearsome US Navy weapon in the Pacific
description: Born of the Cold War and launched with enough firepower to destroy well over a dozen Soviet cities in a single salvo, the USS Ohio, the largest submarine the United States Navy has ever put to sea, has been stripped of its nuclear missiles.

title: 'We're medical doctors, not spin doctors': Reiner calls out Trump doctor
description: CNN's Erin Burnett and Dr. Jonathan Reiner call out former President Donald Trump's doctor, Dr. Sean Conley, for the information he omitted about the President's condition as he battled Covid-19.

title: 3 Republican senators meet with Trump's defense team
description: A trio of Republican senators allied with former President Donald Trump met with his defense team Thursday evening, in the middle of an impeachment trial in which they will vote on whether to convict Trump and potentially bar him from holding public office again.

title: These women say QAnon has turned their parents into strangers
description: These two women share a gut-wrenching story: their parents have been bought into QAnon's lies, and it's tearing their families apart. Hear their stories.
